intro: Biscutella laevigata subsp. hispidissima, commonly known as the hispid biscutella, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, typical of the mustard family. It is native to regions of Central Asia and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
